Robert Dion said until Mike Pence gave up his House Republican leadership role, he expected Mike Pence to target another position: the U.S. House speaker's podium. I've been telling people for a couple of years now that if I were him, I would have my eye on the speakership. He's got a reasonably safe seat, and he was in the leadership of the House Republican conference, and people liked him. I'd stick around and keep my eye on that, he said. Other senior Fianna Fail figures were reportedly canvassing for support. and Sinn Fein parties called for immediate elections to be called. It is simply not tenable for Mr Brian Cowen to remain on as Taoiseach as his colleagues in Fianna Fail squabble over the remnants of their party, Labour leader Eamon Gilmore said. management shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Mr Eric Schmidt said in a statement.`` By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The next step is to reduce U.S. unemployment, an issue Barack Obama should make`` the centerpiece'' of his annual State of the Union address on Jan. 25, the former Cabinet member said. The American people are expecting him to say something about what he's going to do to keep the economy moving forward, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell has criticized his own party in recent months while supporting Barack Obama 's ultimately successful fight for Senate ratification of a new nuclear-arms-reduction treaty with Russia.
